titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (S. 475) to amend title 5, United States Code, to designate Juneteenth National Independence Day as a legal public holiday.
Providing for consideration of the bill (S. 475) to amend title 5, United States Code, to designate Juneteenth National Independence Day as a legal public holiday.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-62, by Ms. Scanlon.
The resolution provides for one motion to commit.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 20.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 479.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 208 (Roll no. 163).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of S. 475 to amend title 5, U.S. Code, to designate Juneteenth National Independence Day as a legal public holiday.
